TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void TouchFrameEventHandler(object sender, TouchFrameEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed TouchFrameEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: The object where the event handler is attached.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Input.TouchFrameEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
